Having good relative pitch means that you can start at a note and match the intervals going from note to note in a tune, even if the key is changed.  Someone who can identify individual notes played by an instrument is said to have "perfect pitch."  That person may or may not actually have a good ear for music, they can simply identify notes.  Having perfect pitch does not necessarily mean that a person has a good ear for music, although it is usually the case.  They are simply two different musical terms.  (says the singer).
